title: Market English: Greetings
summary: A 12-week practical course for vendors focused on greetings, polite conversation, and customer interactions.

weeks.title: introduction for market english
activities: Learn 10 new English words used in the market.
Practice self-introduction audio ("My name is… I sell…")
Group chat activity: Introduce yourself in English.

exercises.question: What is one reason to learn English for market sellers?
Record a short self-introduction: 'My name is..., I sell...'
Participate in the group chat: introduce yourself in English and say one market word from the vocabulary list.

weeks.title: Basic Greetings
activities: Listen & repeat: Hello, Hi, Good morning, Good evening
Pair practice: record yourself greeting a customer
Flashcard game: match greeting and response
Mini dialogue practice

exercises.question: Which is a greeting for the morning?
Record yourself saying 'Hello, how can I help you?'

weeks.title: Introducing Yourself and Others
activities: Watch demo conversation: 'This is my friend John'
Write a short introduction
Partner activity: introduce another person in a recording
Vocabulary review: name, work, place

exercises.question: Fill the blank: 'My name ___ John.'

weeks.title: Greeting Customers and Starting a Conversation
activities: Watch sample customer greeting video
Role-play: greet a customer and ask what they need
Discussion: first impressions
Create 3 greetings for different times of day

phrases.phrase: What can I get for you?
phrases.phonetic: What can I get for you?

exercises.question: Best greeting when a customer enters in the morning?

options.text: Good morning, how can I help?

weeks.title: Asking and Answering Simple Questions
activities: Learn question words: What, Where, How, Who
Pair practice: ask and answer 'Where are you from?'
Flashcard drills for question patterns
Listening exercise with customer questions

exercises.question: Which word is used to ask about location?

weeks.title: Courtesy Expressions
activities: Watch: 'Using Please and Thank You.'
Practice polite words in dialogues
Create 5 polite sentences
Discussion: why politeness matters

exercises.question: Which phrase shows politeness?

weeks.title: Everyday Market Conversations
activities: Listen to a typical market conversation
Dialogue practice: seller and buyer
Vocabulary: prices, items, money
Pronunciation practice: 'thousand', 'price', 'money'

exercises.question: Record a short role-play of a seller and buyer (audio).

weeks.title: Making Small Talk with Customers
activities: Watch examples: weather & day talk
Create and record 3 small talk phrases
Pair practice: short informal conversation
Vocabulary: weather & feelings

exercises.question: Which phrase is small talk?

weeks.title: Greeting in Special Situations
activities: Learn holiday & special event phrases
Create a greeting card in English
Practice greetings for elders & foreigners
Discussion: formal vs informal greetings

exercises.question: Which is a holiday greeting?

weeks.title: Market Etiquette and Body Language
activities: Watch: polite gestures and eye contact
Reflect on gestures that are rude vs friendly
Record a short video demonstrating good posture & greeting
Vocabulary: smile, handshake, kind

exercises.question: Which gesture is usually friendly?

weeks.title: Review and Practice through Role Plays
activities: Review greetings, polite phrases, and questions
Perform role-play: meeting a new customer
Watch peer videos and vote for best greeting
Group challenge: write a mini dialogue

phrases.phrase: Try saying it again more slowly
phrases.translation: Essayez de le dire plus lentement
phrases.phonetic: Try saying it again more slowly

exercises.question: Complete the comprehensive review quiz and submit a short dialogue.

weeks.title: Assessment and Celebration
activities: Final oral test (audio/video greeting)
Self-reflection survey: what did you learn?
Short final group chat in English
Award celebration badge or certificate
